{{cpp/io/istrstream/title|~istrstream}}
{{cpp/io/istrstream/navbar}}
{{ddcl|deprecated=c++98|removed=c++26|1=
virtual ~istrstream();
}}

Destroys a {{tt|std::istrstream}} object, which also destroys the member {{lc|std::strstreambuf}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Notes===
The constructors of {{lc|std::istrstream}} do not create the underlying {{lc|std::strstreambuf}} in dynamically allocated mode, so the memory leaks that are possible with {{lc|std::ostrstream::~ostrstream}} or {{lc|std::strstream::~strstream}} do not apply.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;strstream&gt;

int main()
{
    {
        std::istrstream s("1.234");
        double d;
        s &gt;&gt; d;
        std::cout &lt;&lt; d &lt;&lt; '\n';
    } // destructor called
}
|output=
1.234
}}
